title: Kamlesh Tiwari Murder Probe, Another PMC Bank Depositor Dies And Other Top News Of The Day
text:
Kamlesh Tiwari Murder Probe, Another PMC Bank Depositor Dies And Other Top News Of The Day

Kamlesh Tiwari Murder Probe, Another PMC Bank Depositor Dies And Other Top News Of The Day

Three people have been arrested and two others have been detained for questioning in connection with the ongoing investigation into the murder of Kamlesh Tiwari, the leader of a little known political outfit Hindu Samaj Party.

The three men arrested by the Gujarat Police from Surat identified as Maulana Sheikh Salim, Faizan, and Rashad Pathan, all in their early 20s are said to be the brains behind the murder. Read more

Another PMC Bank Depositor, With Rs 80 Lakh Savings, Dies In Mumbai; 'Had No Funds For Surgery'

In a tragic incident, an 83-year-old depositor of the troubled PMC Bank died on Friday, with his family claiming that it could not raise money for his heart surgery after restrictions were imposed on fund withdrawals.

This is a fourth incident of the death of a depositor of the Punjab & Maharashtra Cooperative Bank after the RBI appointed administrator on the city-headquartered lender. Read more

88 Kg Gold, Forex Among Rs 500 Crore Worth Assets Recovered In I-T Raids On Self-Styled Godman Kalki Bhagavan

Income Tax Department has found undisclosed income worth Rs 500 crore and links to investments in tax havens by self-styled godman Kalki Bhagwan, his family, and trusts run by them during a massive search operation covering 40 premises across various states.

Searches were conducted in Chennai, Hyderabad, Bangalore, and Varadaiahpalem in entities linked to the self-styled Godman. Read more

Nearly 7 Percent Of Milk Sold In India Is Unsafe For Consumption, Some Even Have Cancer-Causing Substances, Finds Study

Milk contamination is a bigger problem in India than milk adulteration, a nationwide study by the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India’s (FSSAI) has found.

The National Milk Safety and Quality Survey 2018 which examined 6,432 samples from 1,103 cities across the country found that nearly 97 percent of them are safe to consume. Read more

Young Generation Once Again Shows The Way As Lakhs Of Students In Punjab Turn Into Anti-Stubble Burning Ambassadors

Lakhs of students from across schools in rural Punjab have come together to become ‘ambassadors of anti-stubble burning campaign’ of the Punjab government.

On Friday lakhs of children studying in schools situated in rural areas participated in the anti-stubble burning rallies organized in the respective villages to disseminate the message of clean, green and pollution-free Punjab. Read more

2nd Such Incident In A Week: Now Dead Fish Seen Floating In TN, Shows How We've Ruined Our Environment

In a matter of weeks, another incident of dead fish seen floating in Tamil Nadu water bodies came to the fore in quick succession. Now, dead fish were seen floating in the backwater besides Kothandaramaswamy Temple near Dhanushkodi on Saturday morning.

Fishermen in the area said that the cause of the deaths of the fishes, locally known as Koi fishes, may be attributed to the mixing of cold rainwater in the warm backwater. Read more
